p: In a paper by O. A. Idris et al., the authors reported the in vitro bioactivities of Rumex crispus L. leaf and root extracts using toxicity, antimicrobial, and antiparasite assays. The study revealed that Rumex crispus has potency against microorganisms, Trypanosoma and Plasmodium, and could be a potential source for the treatment of these diseases.
